CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Access to court);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
JUDGES: Branko Lubarda;Georgios A. Serghides;Pere Pastor Vilanova
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . DATE the applicant , as an entrepreneur , was providing heating installation services to PERSON proizvodnju konfekcije i trikotaže PERSON , a socially - owned company based in ORG ( hereinafter “ the debtor company ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG opened insolvency proceedings in respect of the debtor company ( St. CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . The applicant duly submitted his claim .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected his claim and instructed him to initiate a regular civil suit and request determination of his claim . The applicant lodged a separate civil claim .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ruled in favour of the applicant by recognizing his claim and ordered the debtor company to pay the applicant the costs of the civil proceedings .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date thereafter , the said judgment having become final , was acknowledged within the insolvency proceedings .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG issued a decision ordering payment of PERCENT of the total debt to the applicant . The applicant received this payment on an unspecified date .
CARDINAL . The debtor company was ultimately struck from the relevant public register on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional appeal complaining against ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE and that his right to work and right to compensation for work and providing services were infringed , because he received PERCENT of the total debt . He asked further ORG to order the payment of the rest of the debt .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal finding that it is not vested with the power to order such a payment . That decision was delivered to the applicant after DATE .
